definition: board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Get plank brick this matter, if stem good, call to meekly tolerate insult negative heavy.
sentences.chinese: 挨板磚這事，如果幹得好，叫忍辱負重。

sentences.english: At the time of purchase to the floor, at least to moderate more.
sentences.chinese: 所以在購買地板磚時，起碼要中檔以上的。

sentences.english: Floor tile high prices are on the hundred dollars, the lowest of only a few dollars a piece.
sentences.chinese: 地板磚價高的有上百元，價低的只有幾元一塊。

sentences.english: Toilets are neat and clean , that flushes are working and no leaking and floor tiles are in good order.
sentences.chinese: 整潔乾淨，沖洗設備工作無漏泄，地板磚狀況良好。

sentences.english: So when buying floor tile, at least to mid-range or more.
sentences.chinese: 所以在購買地板磚時，起碼要中檔以上的。

sentences.english: Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick.
sentences.chinese: 雖然命運有時候會拿起板磚，猛拍你的腦袋。

sentences.english: we love the black &white floor tiles in our kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我們喜愛廚房間裏黑白相間的地板磚。

definition: variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
lit. to shoot from both sides (idiom)/fig. to display ambidexterity/to slap with one hand and then the other, in quick succession/to use both feet equally (football)
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
weary old body (colloquial term, used jocularly or irreverently)
with dishevelled hair (idiom)/with one's hair down
alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm)/warning device
